Name: heat production, lignite briquette, at stove 5-15kW | heat, central or small-scale, other than natural gas | EN15804GD, U
Category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply
Description: Average technology installed in early 1990s. The efficiency factor of a coal stove is between 50% and 70%. Since the coal stove is installed in the room to be heated, losses occur especially through the large amounts of flue gas and through incomplete combustion. An efficiency factor of 70% is assumed. Since neither ventilators nor air supply pumps are required for hot water circulation, no auxiliary energy is needed.;Reference:;Braun H., Angr체ner B., Ecker P., Gschaider R., Sorger A., Wurst F., Ellinger R.
